name: 洪媽益
objective: 本課程主要在培養進階寫作能力，採用功能導向的方式，諸如書函，文章／書本摘要，評論，創作，學術專技報告等專項進行演練。
schedule:
February 20, Orientation, Understanding Style
February 27, holiday
March 6, Style: Correctness; Expository Essays
March 13, on official leave
March 20, Style: Actions; Oral presentations: MLA Citation Style
March 27, Style: Characters; Oral presentations: APA Citation Style
April 3, holiday
April 10, Style: Cohesion and Coherence; Problem/Solution Essays
April 17, Style: Emphasis; Oral presentations: The Elements of Style I/II
April 24, Style: Motivation; Summary/Response Essays
May 1, Style: Global Coherence; Oral presentations: The Elements of Style III
May 8, on leave, make-up class to be scheduled on a Friday morning
May 15, Style: Concision; Argumentative Essays
May 22, Style: Shape; Oral presentations: The Elements of Style V
May 29, holiday
June 5, Style: Elegance; Research Papers
June 12, final presentations
June 19, final paper due
END
scorePolicy:
Homework and quizzes: 60
	includes AWL exercises (20%), Style exercises (40%), Writing Tasks (40%)
Writing Tasks (due date): a. Annotated Bibliography or an essay incorporating at least ten (10) articles (May 1); b. any one of the four (4) types of essays with a reflection on a visit to the Writing Center (May 26)
Oral presentations: 25
Final paper: 15 (June 19)
END
materials:
Angell, Roger. 2000. The Elements of Style. 4th Edition. New York: Longman. ISBN0 321 24861 9 (required)
Bizup, Joseph and Joseph M. Williams. 2014. Style: Lessons in Clarity and Grace. Eleventh Edition. Harlow: Pearson. ISBN 978 1 292 03979 4 (required)
Meyers, Alan. 2014. Longman Academic Writing Series: Essays to Research Papers. Harlow: Pearson. ISBN 978 0 13 291274 7
END
